intro: Huernia pulchra, commonly known as the pale moon cactus, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems that store water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, typically in summer. Its leaves are usually reduced to spines, and it thrives in well-draining soil with minimal water. Huernia pulchra is popular as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
